image.altText: A young girl gives the thumbs up while wearing a Parramatta Eels jersey.

items.synopsis: An inquest looking into mistakes by staff before the death of Rozalia Spadafora at Canberra Hospital hears there was confusion about which doctor was responsible for her bed.

title.children: 'I'm sorry, I did not': Doctor tells coronial inquest she didn't know she was responsible for overseeing 5yo's care

image.altText: Bushfire smoke covers the sky above a highway

items.synopsis: Central west and northern NSW are watching and waiting for a change in weather in the hope it'll ease a severe day of bushfires.

title.children: Challenging conditions see NSW experience 10 emergency-level bushfires fires in one day

image.altText: Jack Wighton wearing a grey suit smiling as he walks along.

items.synopsis: Sergeant David Power concedes he gave "wildly inaccurate evidence" about the alleged altercation which saw him throw NRL star Jack Wighton out of a Canberra nightclub.

title.children: Police officer apologises to NRL star Jack Wighton for wrongly throwing him out of Canberra nightclub

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair standing outdoors.

items.synopsis: The ACT government introduces its voluntary assisted dying bill to the Legislative Assembly, after a decades-long fight to legislate on the issue.

title.children: Katarina's dad starved himself over five 'brutal' weeks. She hopes proposed new ACT laws will prevent similar suffering

image.altText: Shanelle Dawson with parents

items.synopsis: After decades of deception, a protracted police investigation and a very public trial, Shanelle Dawson reclaims her story, sharing the betrayal of losing her mum at the hands of her own father.

title.children: Chris Dawson's misogyny 'major' red flag for daughter Shanelle as she processed mother's disappearance

image.altText: Karen Lancaster, 71, has a concerned expression on her face.

items.synopsis: Virgin Australia is sitting on hundreds of millions of dollars in unused COVID-19 flight credits, with customers who booked flights for routes the airline no longer operates being refused refunds.

title.children: Karen is blind and wants to visit her family, but Virgin Australia won't refund her cancelled flights

image.altText: A young man wears a pink tie-dye shirt and silver necklace

items.synopsis: A man who deliberately lit a gas canister on a four-wheel-drive track, which exploded and killed a young father-to-be, will spend at least the next four years in jail.

title.children: Man jailed for setting alight gas canister on bush track that exploded with 'extraordinary force', killing father-to-be

image.altText: An aerial image shows a volcanic island emitting white smoke surrounded by clear blue sea on a clear day.

items.synopsis: The trial over the deadly White Island eruption has ended with the final defendant, Whakaari Management Limited, handed the court's verdict in Auckland.

title.children: Company held by White Island volcano owners found guilty as criminal proceedings conclude

image.altText: A group of soldiers in a vehicle

items.synopsis: For weeks, the objectives of Israel's ground assault in Gaza have remained obscured by a veil of secrecy. But as tanks push further and further into the coastal enclave, a plan is starting to take shape.

title.children: Israel's war strategy in Gaza is slowly emerging. It's unlike anything they've done there before

image.altText: A ruined section of the Gaza Strip, with smoke rising from destroyed buildings and rubble in the day time

items.synopsis: A spokesperson for the Israeli Defense Forces says the northern part of Gaza is "the centre of gravity of Hamas" and where attacks will be focused, but Israeli strikes will still occur in other parts of the territory. Meanwhile, the UN's special envoy for Syria says the conflict is spilling into the neighbouring state.

title.children: IDF says Israel's focus on northern Gaza, UN envoy says war now spilling into Syria — as it happened

image.altText: Analyn 'Logee' Osias smiles for a selfie with the sun softly shining on tents behind her.

items.synopsis: Homicide squad detectives have charged a 44-year-old man with murder over the death of a Bendigo mother on Sunday.

title.children: Police lay murder charge over death of Bendigo mother Analyn 'Logee' Osias

image.altText: The War of the Worlds

items.synopsis: Eighty-five years ago this week, families across the United States settled down around their radios for what they thought would be a regular evening — then Martians attacked.

title.children: 85 years ago, tensions were running high. Here's why one hour of radio sparked weeks of outrage

image.altText: Purple spheres clump together in grape-like clusters

items.synopsis: The study's lead author says many children and babies in Asia-Pacific treated for common infections with antibiotics also used in Australia were dying because those drugs were "no longer working".

title.children: New study shows 'alarming rates' of antibiotic resistant bacteria on Australia's doorstep

image.altText: Stan Grant in a suit and short

items.synopsis: Stan Grant says he woke up the day after the Indigenous Voice to Parliament referendum result surrounded by "eternal darkness".

title.children: Former Q+A host Stan Grant seemingly takes aim at Jacinta Nampijinpa Price in referendum reflections

image.altText: A silhouette of an oil pump in Montana with the sun low in the background

items.synopsis: Energy analysts grow increasingly nervous about unrest in the Middle East with the World Bank warning that a spillover of hostilities in the region could send oil prices to record highs.

title.children: With the Middle East on a knife edge, the World Bank warns of $US150-a-barrel oil

image.altText: Man smoking

items.synopsis: A man accused of knocking out a mother in front her child at a playground and leaving her blind in one eye has been granted bail at Wollongong Court.

title.children: Man who allegedly knocked out a mother in front of her child at a playground granted bail

image.altText: Man pointing a gun.

items.synopsis: A man has been jailed for holding two Newcastle service station workers hostage, one of whom helped resolve the "terrifying" situation by saying she was pregnant.

title.children: 'Haphazard' hostage taker jailed for nine years

image.altText: A composite image of Rebekah Vardy and Coleen Rooney

items.synopsis: The WAGatha Christie scandal rocked the UK, and some would say the world. Now, a year since the trial ended in Coleen Rooney's favour, the woman who sparked a scandal with a single social media post tells her story in a three-part documentary series.

title.children: It's … WAGatha Christie: What we've learned from the Coleen Rooney documentary

image.altText: CCTV image shows three people on the floor and a person on a phone.

items.synopsis: The family of an Aboriginal man who died after an incident involving two security guards says new allegations of violence in the industry show lessons have not been learnt.

title.children: This man yelled 'I can't breathe' before he died. There was no global outcry

image.altText: Headshot selfie of a young woman wearing glasses

items.synopsis: Cameron Pearson, who is believed to be the partner of 34-year-old Perth lawyer Alice McShera, appears in court after her body was found in an upmarket hotel room on Monday, as tributes flow for the family law specialist.

title.children: ‘Someone to aspire to’: Tributes flow for lawyer found dead at Crown Towers as alleged murderer faces court

image.altText: A man in his early 20s smiling at the camera.

items.synopsis: The NSW health system faces calls for more standardised training after 20-year-old Adam Fitzpatrick died in Sydney's St George Hospital following a "very common" procedure.

title.children: Car crash victim with '97 per cent chance of survival' died after four doctors' 'unsatisfactory' conduct, inquest finds

image.altText: Renewable energy: wind and solar.

items.synopsis: Satellite data shows the massive explosion of rooftop solar from above, but the rest of Australia's energy transition is falling behind. Search for your suburb's rooftop solar count.

title.children: How Australia's push into rooftop solar is powering the suburbs

image.altText: Shandee Blackburn was murdered in Mackay in February 2013

items.synopsis: A commission has heard bloodstains from Shandee Blackburn's murder case gave "really low" DNA results when tested, but nothing was ever done about it.

title.children: 'Should have raised a red flag': Expert slams practices at Queensland's forensics lab over 'poor' DNA results

image.altText: An animated gif showing a digital toggle with a lightning bolt image inside it being switch from left to right, changing colour

items.synopsis: The COP28 summit reworks its website after a "low carbon" toggle is found to have little impact on its energy usage.

title.children: 'A classic example of greenwashing': UN climate summit website criticised over 'low carbon' toggle

image.altText: A table with Halloween decorations on it including a candle and some skulls

items.synopsis: With more than four decades of experience working in the police force, Josef Sestokas was thrown into plenty of gruesome scenarios but he never expected to be reminded of them when driving down his street.

title.children: Halloween may be fun for some, but for others it can be triggering

image.altText: A man wearing a blue blazer, white shirt and blue tie and glasses walks along a busy street.

items.synopsis: A Perth court hears new details in the case of the former chief executive of Joondalup Health Campus after he pleaded guilty to charges relating to accessing and soliciting child abuse material online.

title.children: Former Perth hospital chief paid adults to share stories about underage sexual experiences, court hears

image.altText: Ground crews in Tara are battling a number of fires.

items.synopsis: Emergency warnings were issued for Nymboida, Tabulam and Tenterfield in NSW on Tuesday, while dangerous fire conditions remained in south-western Queensland. Look back on how the day unfolded with our blog.

title.children: Multiple emergency warnings issued for fires in NSW, more than 50 homes lost in Qld blazes — as it happened

image.altText: Matthew Perry, Matt LeBlanc, Courteney Cox Arquette, Lisa Kudrow, David Schwimmer and Jennifer Aniston hold a picture frame

items.synopsis: Actor Matthew Perry's co-stars from the iconic sitcom Friends pay tribute to the late actor in a statement to People.

title.children: Matthew Perry's Friends co-stars pay tribute to the late actor

image.altText: A woman with brunette hair, a man with brunette hair and a woman with grey hair.

items.synopsis: When it comes to celebrities, they aren't the main source of information people use, so why do we care so much about a celebrity's stance on news events?

title.children: Why do people consume news through social media and celebrities?

image.altText: Doohan

items.synopsis: Rising motorsport star Jack Doohan reveals his future F1 plans, and how he's following in the footsteps of his legendary MotoGP world champion dad Mick.

title.children: With an F1 seat on his horizon, Jack Doohan is learning the tricks of the trade from his famous father

image.altText: Close-up of an adult powerful owl showing its huge yellow eyes

items.synopsis: Conservationists are working with citizen scientists to ensure the powerful owl is protected as habitat loss drives it into new areas.

title.children: Why Australia's largest owl is being forced further into urban areas

image.altText: Still featuring Leonardo DiCaprio, Lily Gladstone and Robert De niro

items.synopsis: Studios have cracked down on a handful of overseas cinemas for running Killers of the Flower Moon with an interval, but the head of two dozen cinemas in Australia says customers should be given a choice.

title.children: 'It's about choice': Cinema CEO blasts studios over no interval for Killers of the Flower Moon
